workflow_node.start.label: Start
workflow_node.start.form.trigger.label: Trigger
workflow_node.start.form.trigger_cron.er: Please enter a valid CRON expression
workflow_node.start.form.trigger_cron.to: Exactly 5 space separated segments, in standard crontab rules.
workflow_node.start.form.trigger_cron.he: Expected execution time for the last 5 times (the actual time zone is based on the server):
workflow_node.start.form.trigger_cron.gu:
If you have multiple workflows, it is recommended to set them to run at different times of the day instead of always running at a specific time. And please don't always set it to midnight every day to avoid spikes in traffic.

Reference links:
1. Let’s Encrypt rate limits
2. Why should my Let’s Encrypt (ACME) client run at a random time?
workflow_node.apply.label: Request certificate
workflow_node.apply.form.identifier.opti:
• Supports single-domain, multi-domain and wildcard domains (Depends on CA).
  • Supports DNS-01 or HTTP-01 challenge.

• Supports IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
  • Only supports HTTP-01 challenge.
  • Default configuration: No common name.
  • Default configuration: CA is Let's Encrypt.
  • Default configuration: ACME profile is shortlived.
  • Shorter certificate validity and renewal interval.
workflow_node.apply.form.domains.label: Domains
workflow_node.apply.form.domains.help: Notes: Multiple domains should be separated by semicolons. Wildcard domain should be written as *.example.com.
workflow_node.apply.form.domains.help_no: Notes: Multiple domains should be separated by semicolons.
workflow_node.apply.form.ipaddrs.label: IP addresses
workflow_node.apply.form.ipaddrs.placeho: Please enter IP addresses (separated by semicolons)
workflow_node.apply.form.ipaddrs.help: Notes: Multiple IP addresses should be separated by semicolons.
workflow_node.apply.form.contact_email.t: Contact information required for SSL certificate application. Please pay attention to the rate limits.
Could not use HTTP-01 challenge to request wildcard domain certificates.
Could not use DNS-01 challenge to request IP address certificates.

It determines how the CAs verifies your control over the domain names.
Click here to learn more.

Please select the DNS provider of the domains
workflow_node.apply.form.provider_http01: Please select the hosting provider of the domains
workflow_node.apply.form.provider_access: Please select an credential of provider
Please select an credential of DNS provider
Please select an credential of hosting provider
workflow_node.apply.form.aliyun_esa_regi: Please enter Alibaba Cloud ESA region (e.g. cn-hangzhou)
workflow_node.apply.form.aws_route53_reg: Please enter AWS Route53 region (e.g. us-east-1)
workflow_node.apply.form.aws_route53_hos: Please enter AWS Route53 hosted zone ID
Notes: Only required when there are several hosted zones with the same FQDN.
workflow_node.apply.form.huaweicloud_dns: Please enter Huawei Cloud DNS region (e.g. cn-north-1)
workflow_node.apply.form.jdcloud_dns_reg: Please enter JD Cloud DNS region ID (e.g. cn-north-1)
workflow_node.apply.form.s3_region.label: Object storage (S3-compatible) region
workflow_node.apply.form.s3_bucket.label: Object storage (S3-compatible) bucket
workflow_node.apply.form.local_webroot_p: It's the main directory where the website's files are stored on the server.
workflow_node.apply.form.ssh_webroot_pat: It's the main directory where the website's files are stored on the server.
workflow_node.apply.form.ssh_use_scp.too: If the remote server does not support SFTP, please check this option to fallback to SCP.
workflow_node.apply.form.key_algorithm.h: Notes: If there is an existing certificate, the original key algorithm will be used.
Notes: Please ensure that the algorithm matches the private key.
workflow_node.apply.form.key_content.err: Please enter a valid PEM private key
Private key does not match the key algorithm (Expected: {{expected}}, Actual: {{actual}})
workflow_node.apply.form.ca_provider_acc: Please select an credential of the certificate authority
workflow_node.apply.form.validity_lifeti: Notes: Not all CAs support this feature.
It determines the NotAfter field of the certificate in the ACME protocol. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
workflow_node.apply.form.preferred_chain: Notes: Not all CAs support this feature.

It determines the PreferredChain field of the certificate in the ACME protocol. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
Click here to learn more.
workflow_node.apply.form.acme_profile.he: Notes: Not all CAs support this feature.
workflow_node.apply.form.acme_profile.to:
It determines the Profile field of the certificate in the ACME protocol. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
Click here to learn more.
workflow_node.apply.form.disable_cn.tool:
It determines whether to include the Subject.CommonName field in the certificate. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
Click here to learn more.
workflow_node.apply.form.nameservers.pla: Please enter DNS recursive nameservers (separated by semicolons)
workflow_node.apply.form.nameservers.too:
It determines whether to custom DNS recursive nameservers during ACME challenge. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
Click here to learn more.
workflow_node.apply.form.dns_propagation: Please enter DNS propagation waiting time
It determines the waiting time for DNS propagation during ACME DNS-01 challenge. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
Please enter DNS propagation checks timeout
It determines the timeout for DNS propagation checks during ACME DNS-01 challenge. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
workflow_node.apply.form.dns_ttl.label: DNS TTL (Optional)
workflow_node.apply.form.dns_ttl.help: Notes: Leave it blank to use the default value provided by the DNS provider.
workflow_node.apply.form.dns_ttl.tooltip: It determines the TTL for DNS record during ACME DNS-01 challenge. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
workflow_node.apply.form.http_delay_wait: Please enter HTTP delay waiting time
It determines a delay between the start of the HTTP server and the challenge validation during ACME HTTP-01 challenge. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
workflow_node.apply.form.disable_follow_:
It determines whether to disable CNAME following during ACME DNS-01 challenge. If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
Click here to learn more.
workflow_node.apply.form.disable_ari.too:
It determines whether to disable ARI (ACME Renewal Information). If you don't understand this option, just keep it by default.
Click here to learn more.
workflow_node.apply.form.skip_before_exp: If the last certificate expiration time exceeds

workflow_node.monitor.label: Monitor certificate
workflow_node.monitor.form.guide: It will send a HEAD request to the target address to obtain the certificate. Please ensure that the address is accessible through HTTPS protocol.

workflow_node.monitor.form.port.label: Port

workflow_node.deploy.label: Deploy certificate
workflow_node.deploy.form.certificate_ou: Notes: The certificate to be deployed comes from the previous nodes of application or upload.
workflow_node.deploy.form.provider.label: Deployment target
workflow_node.deploy.form.provider_acces: Please select an credential of hosting provider
workflow_node.deploy.form.shared_domain_: Notes: For the sites which support wildcard resolution, an exact match of a wildcard domain only includes the site itself, does not include its subdomains.
workflow_node.deploy.form.shared_script_:
Supported variables:
  1. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CMDVAR_CERTIFICATE_PATH}:
    The path of the certificate file, same as the value of the form related field.
  2. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CMDVAR_CERTIFICATE_SERVER_PATH}:
    The path of the server certificate file, same as the value of the form related field.
  3. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CMDVAR_CERTIFICATE_INTERMEDIA_PATH}:
    The path of the intermediate CA certificate file, same as the value of the form related field.
  4. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CMDVAR_PRIVATEKEY_PATH}:
    The path of the private key file, same as the value of the form related field.
  5. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CMDVAR_PFX_PASSWORD}:
    The PFX password, same as the value of the form related field.
  6. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CMDVAR_JKS_ALIAS}:
    The JKS alias, same as the value of the form related field.
  7. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CMDVAR_JKS_KEYPASS}:
    The JKS key password, same as the value of the form related field.
  8. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CMDVAR_JKS_STOREPASS}:
    The JKS store password, same as the value of the form related field.

workflow_node.deploy.form.webhook_data.v:
Supported variables:
  1. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_COMMONNAME}:
    The primary domain or IP address of the certificate.
  2. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_SUBJECTALTNAMES}:
    The domains or IP addresses of the certificate, separated by semicolons.
  3. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CERTIFICATE}:
    The PEM format content of the certificate file.
  4. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CERTIFICATE_SERVER}:
    The PEM format content of the server certificate file.
  5. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_CERTIFICATE_INTERMEDIA}:
    The PEM format content of the intermediate CA certificate file.
  6. ${CERTIMATE_DEPLOYER_PRIVATEKEY}:
    The PEM format content of the private key file.

workflow_node.notify.label: Send notification
workflow_node.notify.form.subject.label: Subject
workflow_node.notify.form.message.label: Message
workflow_node.notify.form.template.guide:
The content using the "Mustache" syntax (double curly braces) and preceded by "$" in the subject or message are text interpolations. They will be replaced by the actual values.
Supported text interpolations:
  1. Workflow:
    1. workflow.id: The ID of the workflow.
    2. workflow.name: The name of the workflow.
    3. run.id: The ID of the workflow run.
  2. Error:
    (If there are multiple nodes that have failed before this, it always indicate the nearest one.)
    1. error.nodeId: The node ID that execution failed.
    2. error.nodeName: The node name that execution failed.
    3. error.message: The error message that execution failed.
  3. Certificate:
    (If there are multiple nodes outputting a certificate before this, it always indicate the nearest one.)
    1. certificate.commonName: The primary domain or IP address of the certificate.
    2. certificate.subjectAltNames: The domains or IP addresses of the certificate, separated by semicolons.
    3. certificate.notBefore: The effect time of the certificate, formatted in RFC3339.
    4. certificate.notAfter: The expire time of the certificate, formatted in RFC3339.
    5. certificate.hoursLeft: The left hours of the certificate.
    6. certificate.daysLeft: The left days of the certificate.
    7. certificate.validity: The validity of the certificate.
  4. Other:
    1. now: The current time on the server, formatted in RFC3339.

Example:
Your workflow {{ $workflow.name }} has failed on node {{ $error.nodeName }} at {{ $now }}.
